author: Amith Mendis
title: Decentralized Content Platform
description:
Content Platforms (Netflix) are making Billions as the profit as the middleman.  
Unfair rewarding for creators  
High fees for end users

assessments.note: The proposal clearly describes and attacks the problem by tokenisation and increased transaction amounts through service. Scalability is also possible.

I give a 2 for impact because it is a fantastic idea but I think the timeline for implementation is fantasy at best. The proposal says that by later this year 10 studios will be on board to host their content on the application but there are no business development people on the team. There is no evidence that there are connections to studios who would host their content on this application. So the challenge of getting this done in 2021 is just not going to be met. However, they could likely get their platform up and running it just won't have premium content at a level comparable to netflix. I think this app could add a lot of value to cardano users.
If this works, would be great for the customer. A platform which can unite every streaming platform and cheaper than average.

The idea is great, it is a good application of blockchain as a way to remove the middleman and to benefit both creators and viewers. This could bring great visibility to Cardano. There are some platforms similar to this, but I see the difference that no middle man at all would exist in this case.

From skill point of view the team is very strong as well there is a rough time plan attached. It would be useful to address the risks a bit more. In my eyes the biggest challenge is how to convince big studio or production house to join this movement and why they would do so. If this part is not analysed in a detail all the metrics applied for measuring the amount of user base and expansion becomes irrelevant. In overall the requested budget seems right.

I give a 1 based on the proposal itself. It is not feasible for 10 studios by mid year and 50 by year end to be on board to directly host their content on this application. I believe a lot can be done in this year, but not what the proposal says will be done.

The problem that I see is, the majority of streaming providers nowadays are offering their own movies – Netflix with its own prod., Disney+, HBO, YT, etc. Therefore, I'm very curious to understand how are you intending to pitch them to use this platform.

I bet you will have lots of users if there is lots of good/new movies on the platform, however I've not seen a plan for that.

Furthermore, I wish you had a more detailed budget.

I believe that the team has relevant experience to make this happen, although it seems that there are no blockchain devs already engaged with the project. Also, I see the lack of commercial experience, specially in the area of video content and IP In general, as a possible down sides. I believe that the targets for 2021 and 2022 are very optimistic. It doesn't mean it won't happen, I just think it will take longer than what is stated in the proposal.

With a greater team (also because of speed of developing, testing and marketing thid might be a successful project. To keep the costs low and the commitment high, py every memeber of the team a basic salary, just for staying alive and a share of the gains after release.

I would welcome a bit separated structure for this project with more pre-research part. Identify the studios who would join and spend some amount of the dedicated budget onto and than based on the result modify the following plans. This way the roadmap would become more leaner and if the 1st phase of identifying the first adapters becomes successful the later actions can be simply followed, audited and measured.

I give a 2 for auditability since their main metric for success is number of users. I think the code, marketing, and other metrics need to be included to be audited but the proposal includes very little to go off of.
Probably adding a more detailed roadmap with in order to give more information and points to the public verify the steps being accomplished.

The targets set for this development are very optimistic and I am not sure if they are achievable. But in any way, they are pointed out. Some milestones regarding the development of the main platform should be included as well. Risks involving possible IP problems with movie studios should be assessed, and budget should be broken down to make it easier to audit.

There is no concrete plan on what is happening technically to facilitate a stream platform. Provide a plan on what you are going to make technically, a realistic plan on how you will get content, and how you will market to end users. This is a not a space 30,000 will make an impact in this year (which is the challenge goal).
Due to the roadmap it is quit easy to audit the system when the team issues prograssing reports on a regular base.

solution:
Create a decentralized content platform (Tokenized).

Users - pay only for usage

Creators - rewarding based on the usage
